medical_history.chief_complaint: Open wound on the volar surface of the distal part of the left forearm.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced painful swelling of the forearm following heavy lifting one month prior to presentation. The swollen area spontaneously opened and drained for ten days before the visit. Active finger motion was limited, with painful passive extension.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has hemophilia, with a diagnosis of factor-VIII deficiency made at age twelve following abnormal bleeding at circumcision and after minor injuries throughout childhood. At ten years of age, he underwent a below-the-elbow amputation due to swelling in the right forearm mistaken for osteosarcoma, which resulted in extensive postoperative bleeding.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has a family history of bleeding disorders; three of his twelve siblings (all male) also have factor-VIII deficiency.
